metadata.subject: Re: Exclusive: Bannon blasts 'con artist' Kochs, 'lame duck' Ryan, 'diminished' Kelly I TheHill

relationships.description: Communicating about political strategy and third-party candidate possibilities
Forwarding political analysis and strategy discussions

analysis.purpose: To discuss potential third-party presidential candidates and election strategies for 2020
analysis.significance: Shows high-level political strategizing about challenging the two-party system and potential alternatives to Trump

notable_quotes: For the 48 percent of Americans who believe Donald Trump should not be in the White House, perhaps we too want our own 'chaos' candidate in 2020?
The ideal candidate for a new third party is someone who is widely perceived to be that rare combination of both good and great.
I am sure none of us doubt that chaos could potentially be unleashed by jamming three viable candidates into a two-party system.
red_flags: Political strategizing outside normal party channels
Discussion of disrupting established political processes

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found - this is political strategy discussion

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is political strategy analysis

details: Reference to TheHill article about Bannon's comments
Discussion of media coverage and political narratives

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be private political strategizing about potential third-party candidates for 2020 election, not previously public information

analysis.summary: Email exchange between Steve Bannon and Jeffrey Epstein discussing political strategy for the 2020 election, including detailed analysis of potential third-party candidates and the feasibility of running outside the two-party system to challenge Trump.
